user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of calc_userdigest:
```c
_MHD_static_inline void
calc_userdigest (struct DigestAlgorithm *da,
                 const char *username, const size_t username_len,
                 const char *realm, const size_t realm_len,
                 const char *password,
                 uint8_t *ha1_bin)
{
  mhd_assert (! da->hashing);
  digest_update (da, username, username_len);
  digest_update_with_colon (da);
  digest_update (da, realm, realm_len);
  digest_update_with_colon (da);
  digest_update_str (da, password);
  digest_calc_hash (da, ha1_bin);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No function parameter is reassigned or otherwise modified within calc_userdigest. Analysis by parameter:
- da (struct DigestAlgorithm *): only dereferenced (da->hashing) and passed to helper functions. The pointer variable da itself is not assigned to or modified. Modifying the object *da via helper calls is permitted by Rule 17.8.
- username, realm, password (const char *): passed to digest_update / digest_update_str and not reassigned; they are const pointers to const data, so their pointees cannot be modified here and the pointer variables themselves are not changed.
- username_len, realm_len (size_t): used as arguments and not assigned to; no modification.
- ha1_bin (uint8_t *): passed to digest_calc_hash which may modify the object pointed to by ha1_bin (allowed), but the pointer ha1_bin itself is not reassigned in this function.

All parameter uses are reads or passing to other functions; there are no assignments like parameter = ... or increments/decrements of parameter variables. Therefore there are no code fragments in this function that need further investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8.
